property.description: Enter namespace of the extension functions used in the custom stylesheets. For example, "http://www.fredspace/extensions".
property.name: ExtensionFunctionNamespace

property.description: Enter the extension function within the namespace to map. For example, "nodeset()".
property.name: ExtensionFunction

property.description: Enter the local namespace if it is other than the DataPower default (shown in the box).
property.name: LocalFunctionNamespace

property.description: Enter the local function to use in place of the extension function identified above. For example, "node-set()".
property.name: LocalFunction

value.description: The parser forbids external references. An external reference causes the XML parser to stop when the document contains external references. This setting is the default value.
value.name: forbid

value.description: The parser accesses and resolves external references, but replaces each for further processing with an empty string. This setting can be a security risk.
value.name: ignore

value.description: The parser allows and resolves external references. This setting is a security risk.
value.name: allow

property.description: Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a URL set included in the cache policy. The following wildcard characters are available. <table><tr><td valign="top">asterisk (*)</td><td valign="top">Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character.</td></tr><tr><td valign="top">question mark (?)</td><td valign="top">Matches one occurrence of any single character.</td></tr><tr><td valign="top">brackets ( [ ] )</td><td valign="top">Defines a character or numeric range. For example, <tt>[1-5]</tt> matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while <tt>xs[dl]</tt> matches xsd or xsl.</td></tr></table>
property.name: Match
Type
property.description: Select the cache type. The cache type determines whether to cache documents and the mechanism to use to remove cached entries. The default value is Protocol-Based.

property.name: TTL
property.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for documents in the cache. TTL applies to only the <tt>Fixed</tt> policy type. Enter a value in the range 5 - 31708800. The default value is 900.

property.name: Priority
property.description: <p>Specifies the priority of a document to add to or remove from the cache. The greater the value, the higher its priority. Enter a value in the range 1 - 255. The default value is 128.</p><ul><li>When adding documents, the cache uses the policy with the highest priority. If the document matches multiple policies with the same priority, the cache uses the first matching policy in the alphabetized list.</li><li>When removing documents, the cache removes documents that were added by policies with the lowest priority. If multiple documents have the same priority, the cache removes the document that was least recently accessed.</li></ul><p>When you define multiple policies, the DataPower Gateway retains the policies in an alphabetized list. The DataPower Gateway evaluates candidate documents against each policy. Consequently, the priority of policies is important to ensure that the DataPower Gateway caches candidate documents for the appropriate validity period.</p><ul><li>Use a high priority for policies that you want to cache.</li><li>Use a low priority for generic policies. For example, set the priority to 1 when <tt>*</tt> or <tt>*.xml</tt> is the match pattern.</li></ul>

property.name: XC10Grid
property.summary: The name of the Cache Grid
property.description: The eXtreme Scale grid configuration to use for caching documents.

property.name: CacheBackendResponses
property.summary: Specifies whether to cache back-end responses
property.description: Caches responses to requests from back-end servers.

property.name: HTTPCacheValidation
property.summary: Allow HTTP cache validation with the origin server.
property.description: When a requested HTTP document results in a cache hit, HTTP cache validation with the origin server is performed.

property.name: ReturnExpired
property.description: <p>In the following situations, whether to return expired content when a client requests it. <ul><li>The DataPower Gateway cannot establish a connection with the origin server.</li><li>The document cache is getting the newest version from the origin server.</li></ul></p><p>A document might persist in the cache after the document is expired. When enabled, the cached document is returned even though it is potentially stale. A warning header indicates that the document is stale.</p>

property.name: RESTInvalidation
property.description: Invalidate document cache on unsafe requests. For example, HTTP GET requests are safe requests that do not change the internal state of the server. When an HTTP POST to the same URL occurs, the cache needs to be invalidated because the internal state of the server might have changed. The next GET request must contact the origin service to update the cache with any changes.

property.name: CacheUnsafeResponse
property.summary: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.display: Cache Response to POST and PUT Requests
property.description: Caches responses to POST and PUT requests when the cache policy type is set to fixed. The response to these requests is the result of an action on the server that might change its resource state. You might want to cache responses to these requests when you know that the action (for example: HTTP POST) will not change the server state.
Select the matching rule that is applied to candidate XML documents. Documents whose URL conforms to an expression contained in the matching rule are subject to XML schema validation.
property.name: Matching

property.description: Select the procedure to use to validate a schema.
property.name: ValidationMode
SchemaURL
property.summary: The URL of an XML schema
property.description: Enter the URL of the schema to use for validation. Used only when the Validation Mode is schema or schema-rewrite.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.description: Select a URL Rewrite Policy from the list. Used only the Validation Mode is attribute-rewrite or schema-rewrite.

property.name: DynamicSchema
property.description: Select a dynamic schema used to perform document validation regardless of any validation processing instructions contained within the document. Dynamic schemas used Schema Exception Maps or Document Crypto Maps.
Select the rule to run.
property.name: Rule

property.description: Specify the interval between invocations in seconds. A value of 0 indicates a single invocation.
property.name: Interval

value.description: XML documents are validated in accordance with validation processing instructions, if any, that are contained in the XML document.
value.name: default

value.description: XML documents are validated against the XML schema that is defined by the Schema URL property.
value.name: schema

value.description: XML documents are validated against a rewritten schema reference. That is, a schema reference that is defined by the Schema URL property is rewritten in accordance with a URL Rewrite Policy that is defined by the URL Rewrite Policy property.
value.name: schema-rewrite

value.description: XML documents are validated against a rewritten schema reference. That is, a schema reference that is contained in the XML document is rewritten in accordance with the URL Rewrite Policy that is defined by the URL Rewrite Policy property.
value.name: attribute-rewrite

value.description: XML documents are validated using a Schema Exception Map or Document Crypto Map. One of these maps identifies a schema and excepted elements.
value.name: dynamic-schema

value.description: <p>Caches documents that match the URL expression. HTTP caching rules, as defined in Section 13 of RFC 2616 "Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP 1.1", specify the cache-lifetime. Policy is set using the following criteria. <ul><li>If the document does not contain a <tt>Date</tt> or <tt>Last-Modified</tt> header, do not cache.</li><li>If the document contains a <tt>Vary</tt> header, do not cache.</li><li>If the document contains an HTTP 1.1 <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.</li><li>If the document contains an HTTP 1.0 <tt>Expires</tt> header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine its cache-lifetime.</li><li>If the document contains a <tt>Last-Modified</tt> header, cache and use the contents of that field in conjunction with the <tt>Date</tt> header to determine its cache-lifetime. The cache-lifetime cannot exceed 8 hours.</li></ul></p>
value.name: protocol

value.description: Does not cache documents that match the URL expression.
value.name: no-cache

value.description: Caches documents that match the URL expression. The TTL specifies the validity period for the document in seconds.
value.name: fixed

object.name: XMLManager

property-group.on-glass: These settings do not impact resource allocation. These settings are used only as part of threat protection.
property-group.name: xmlparser

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

Optionally assigns a TLS proxy to the XML manager. The proxy is used as a TLS helper by the manager, and might also be used as a default TLS proxy when fetching documents over TLS and there is no explicit matching TLS policy in the User Agent configuration. This parameter cannot be modified after the XML Manager is created.
property.name: SSLProxy

property.description: Optionally, assigns a Stylesheet Refresh Policy to the XML manager. Stylesheets cached by this manager are refreshed in accordance with policy rules.
property.name: URLRefreshPolicy

property.description: <p>Optionally, assigns a Compilation Options Policy to the XML Manager. Stylesheets cached by this manager are compiled in accordance with policy rules. Compile Options allow the administrator to manage profiling and debug modes, which are helpful during development and troubleshooting sessions. Profiling and debug modes should not be left on for production purposes.</p><p>Compile Options Policy also enables streaming mode, which might be a valid choice for production environments that regularly encounter very large documents.</p>
property.summary: The Compile Options Policy assigned to this XML Manager
property.name: CompileOptionsPolicy
CacheSize
property.summary: Maximum number of stylesheets in XSL Cache
property.description: Enter the maximum number of stylesheets in the XSL cache. Enter a value in the range 5 - 250000. The default value is 256.

property.name: SHA1Caching
property.description: Enables/disables SHA1-assisted stylesheet caching. With SHA1 caching enabled, stylesheets are cached by both URL and SHA1 message digest value. With SHA1 caching disabled, stylesheets are cached only by URL.

property.name: StaticDocumentCalls
property.description: The latest XSLT specifications require that multiple document calls in the same transformation return the same result. Disable to allow all document calls to operate independently.

property.name: SearchResults
property.description: Configures optimization of '//' in XPath expressions

property.name: SupportTxWarn
property.summary: Enables the support of Transformation Extender warning conditions
property.description: Enables the XML manager to support IBM Transformation Extender warning conditions. The DataPower Gateway sets the warning message to the <tt>var:///service/multistep/tx-warn</tt> variable and continues the map-processing when it encounters a warning condition.

property.name: VirtualServers
property.description: Select a Load Balancer Group and assign that group to this XML manager. A Load Balancer Group, or server pool, provides redundancy among backside resources.

Defines a mapping for XSLT extension functions used in custom stylesheets to DataPower-defined extension functions. The most common example is the node-set extension function, offered by several vendors. A namespace-function pair is mapped to the DataPower-supported namespaces, including exslt, and function.
property.name: ExtensionFunctions
ParserLimitsBytesScanned
property.description: Enter the maximum number of bytes scanned in one message. This property applies to any XML document that is parsed. If the value is 0, no limit is enforced. The default value is 4194304.

property.name: ParserLimitsElementDepth
property.description: Enter the maximum depth of element nesting in XML parser. The default value is 512.

property.name: ParserLimitsAttributeCount
property.description: Enter the maximum number of attributes of a given element. The default value is 128.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNodeSize
property.description: Enter the maximum size that any one node can consume. Enter a value in the range 1024 - 4294967295. The default value is 33554432. Sizes which are powers of two result in the best performance. Although you define a value, the DataPower Gateway uses a value that is the rounded-down to the largest power of two that is smaller than the defined value.

property.name: ParserLimitsForbidExternalReferences
property.summary: XML parser forbid external references toggle
property.description: Defines whether the XML parser stops when an input document specifies to resolve an external reference such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: ParserLimitsExternalReferences
property.summary: Special handling for external references in XML
property.description: Select the special handling for input documents that contain external references, such as an external entity or external DTD definition.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxPrefixes
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML namespace prefixes in a document. This limit counts multiple prefixes defined for the same namespace, but does not count multiple namespaces defined in different parts of the input document under a single prefix. Enter a value in the range 0 - 262143. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxNamespaces
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML namespace URIs in a document. This limit counts all XML namespaces, regardless of how many prefixes are used to declare them. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 1024. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 1024.

property.name: ParserLimitsMaxLocalNames
property.summary: XML parser maximum distinct local names
property.description: Enter the maximum number of distinct XML local names in a document. This limit counts all local names, independent of the namespaces they are associated with. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1048575. The default value is 60000. A value of 0 indicates that the limit is 60000.

property.name: DocCacheMaxDocs
property.description: Enter the maximum number of documents to cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 250000. The default value is 5000.

property.name: DocCacheSize
property.description: Enter the maximum size of the document cache. Regardless of the specified size, no document that is greater than 1073741824 bytes is cached. This restriction applies even if the cache has available space.

property.name: DocMaxWrites
property.summary: Maximum number of concurrent writes to create documents in the cache
property.description: Enter the maximum number of concurrent write requests to create documents or refresh expired documents in the document cache. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32768. The default value is 32768. After the maximum number is reached, requests are forwarded to the target server and the response is not written to the cache.

property.name: DocCachePolicy
property.description: A document cache policy allows the administrator to determine how documents are cached by the XML manager. The policy offers time-to-live, priority, and type configuration values. This document cache is distinct from the stylesheet cache for the XML manager. Documents and stylesheets that the XML manager retrieves can be cached.

property.name: SchemaValidation
property.summary: Schema validation rules to apply to all input documents for this manager

property.name: ScheduledRule
property.summary: Run a processing policy rule periodically.
property.description: Certain applications might require the running of a scheduled processing rule. Integration with a CA Unicenter Manager is facilitated by a regularly scheduled processing rule that obtains relationship data from the Unicenter Manager.

property.name: UserAgent
property.summary: Specify the user agent configuration to use.
property.description: Identifies the User Agent configuration the XML manager uses to connect to external servers to retrieve resources.
Identifies the JSON Settings used by the XML manager when processing a JSON body. If no JSON Settings are specified, the default limits are enforced.
property.summary: Specify the JSON Settings to use when processing JSON content
property.name: JSONParserSettings

property.description: Identifies the DFDL Settings used by the XML manager when processing data as understood by a DFDL schema. The reference to a DFDL Settings object on the Style Policy Action can override this setting. If no DFDL Settings are specified on both objects, the default values are applied.
property.summary: Specify the DFDL Settings to use when processing binary content with DFDL schemas.
property.name: DFDLSettingsReference

property.description: Identifies the LDAP connection pool to be used by the XML Manager when contacting LDAP
property.summary: Specify the LDAP Connection Pool to use
property.name: LDAPConnPool

object.description: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy. More than one firewall can use the same XML Manager.
